lead_paragraph: The Justice Department and the New York attorney general, Eric T. Schneiderman, filed separate civil charges last week against Bank of New York Mellon, accusing it of defrauding customers of its foreign exchange services. The cases raise sticky questions about when marketing claims cross the imperceptible line from puffery to fraud.

headline.main: The Difference Between Puffery and Fraud
